text.1_Iyar, 0_Verse: On the 7th of Iyyar was the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, and it is forbidden to mourn thereon.
text.11_Adar, 12_Verse: On the 20th thereof the people fasted for rain (and it descended).
text.2_Sivan, 4_Verse: On the 25th thereof the publicans were removed from Judah and Jerusalem.
text.7_Cheshvan, 2_Verse: On the 25th thereof the wall of Samaria was captured.
text.1_Iyar, 4_Verse: On the 23rd thereof the garrison departed from Jerusalem.
text.5_Elul, 4_Verse: On the 22nd thereof we began to slay the wicked.
text.7_Cheshvan, 4_Verse: On the 27th thereof they began again to bring the offerings of fine flour upon the altar.
text.8_Kislev, 0_Verse: On the 3rd of Kislev the ensigns were removed from the Court.
text.11_Adar, 14_Verse: On the 28th thereof the glad tidings reached the Jews that they were not to be restrained from the study of the Law. It is not permitted to mourn thereon.
text.11_Adar, 8_Verse: On the 16th thereof was begun the building of the wall of Jerusalem; it is forbidden to mourn thereon.
text.8_Kislev, 4_Verse: On the 21st thereof was the day of Mt. Gerizim (on which it is not allowed to mourn).
text.11_Adar, 4_Verse: On the 13th thereof is the day of Nicanor.
text.10_Shevat, 3_Verse: On the 22nd thereof the work on what the enemy commanded to bring into the Temple was stopped; not allowed to mourn.
text.5_Elul, 2_Verse: On the 17th thereof the Romans evacuated Judah and Jerusalem.
text.11_Adar, 6_Verse: On the 14th and 15th thereof (are the days of) Purim, on which it is not allowed to mourn.
text.8_Kislev, 6_Verse: On the 25th thereof is the day of Hanukkah: eight days it is forbidden to mourn.
text.0_Nisan, 0_Verse: These are the days on which one is not allowed to fast, and on some of them it is not permitted to mourn.
text.1_Iyar, 6_Verse: On the 27th thereof was discontinued payment of the tribute (from Judah and Jerusalem).
text.5_Elul, 0_Verse: On the 7th of Elul was the day of the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, on which it is forbidden to mourn.
text.11_Adar, 0_Verse: The 8th and 9th of Adar they supplicated and sounded blasts for rain.
text.7_Cheshvan, 0_Verse: On the 23rd of Heshvan the Sorega was torn away from the 'Azarah.
text.4_Av, 0_Verse: On the 15th of Ab, the day of Xylophoria, it is forbidden to mourn.
text.6_Tishrei, 0_Verse: On the 3rd of Tishri were removed the 'mentions' on documents.
text.11_Adar, 10_Verse: On the 17th thereof the Gentiles arose against the refugees of (?) Sepphoris in the province of Chalcis and in Beth Zabdain, but there came salvation (to the Jews).
text.0_Nisan, 1_Verse: From [on] the 1st [until the 8th] of Nisan was established the Daily offering,- mourning is forbidden.
text.10_Shevat, 0_Verse: On the 7th of Shebat is a holiday, whereon it is not allowed to mourn.
text.10_Shevat, 5_Verse: On the 28th thereof Antiochus (the king) departed from Jerusalem.
text.3_Tammuz, 0_Verse: On the 4th (10th) of Tammuz the book of decrees was removed (on which it is not allowed to mourn).
text.4_Av, 4_Verse: On the 24th thereof we returned to our Law.
text.1_Iyar, 2_Verse: On the 14th thereof (was slaughtered) the Minor Passover, on which it is forbidden to mourn.
text.2_Sivan, 2_Verse: On the 15th and 16th thereof the people of Bethshean {Scythopolis} and the valley were exiled.
text.9_Tevet, 0_Verse: On the 28th of Tebeth the Sanhedrin sat in judgement.
text.0_Nisan, 3_Verse: From the 8th thereof until the close of the festival (of Passover) a holiday (of a week) was declared during which it is forbidden to mourn.
text.2_Sivan, 0_Verse: On the 14th of Sivan the tower of the Fort was captured.
text.11_Adar, 2_Verse: On the 12th thereof is the day of Tyrian.
